content: The "Nevada Native Nations Land Act" defines the term "Secretary" as the Secretary of the Interior and involves the conveyance of land to be held in trust for certain Indian tribes. The Nevada Native Nations Land Act defines the term "Secretary" as the Secretary of the Interior and involves the conveyance of land to be held in trust for the Fort McDermitt Paiute and Shoshone Tribe, expanding their reservation. The Nevada Native Nations Land Act defines the term "Secretary" as the Secretary of the Interior and involves the conveyance of approximately 19,094 acres of land administered by the Bureau of Land Management as "Reservation Expansion Lands" to be held in trust for the Shoshone Paiute Tribes. This land is depicted on the map entitled "Mountain City Administrative Site Proposed Acquisition". The Nevada Native Nations Land Act involves the conveyance of approximately 19,094 acres of land to the Shoshone Paiute Tribes for the Duck Valley Indian Reservation. The land includes approximately 82 acres administered by the Forest Service, subject to an easement for a road for administrative purposes. The Secretary of Agriculture will oversee facilities and improvements on the land. The Agriculture Chief will convey existing facilities to the Shoshone Paiute Tribes of the Duck Valley Indian Reservation. Land will be held in trust for the Summit Lake Paiute Tribe, with all rights transferred to the tribe. The Secretary will survey boundary lines to establish land boundaries for Indian tribes under section 3. Land taken into trust cannot be used for class II or class III gaming. The Secretary can conduct fuel reduction and landscape restoration activities on the trust land in consultation with the tribe. The Secretary can conduct fuel reduction and landscape restoration activities on trust land in consultation with the tribe, benefiting both the Indian tribe and the Bureau of Land Management. The Senate passed S. 1436 on April 14, 2016, requiring the Secretary of the Interior to take land into trust for certain Indian tribes.
